content.html:
Hiya üëã

Happy Thursday! At the start of the year, I had planned to post my Author Journal updates on Mondays to align with most people‚Äôs workweek. However, Monday is the end of my workweek, and I felt rushed to get the post out before the weekend.

So, after a few weeks of trying it out, I‚Äôve decided to return to my original posting plan on Wednesdays. And yes, I know it‚Äôs Thursday today, but I had such a great weekend that I didn‚Äôt want to cut into it by thinking about work. üòä

Now, let‚Äôs take a look at how last week went.

Continue reading ‚ÄúAuthor Journal 9th ‚Äì 15th February 2023‚Äú

I hope you all had a fantastic week because I certainly did! This week was one of the most productive weeks I‚Äôve had in months, and I have yet another secret project to share with you.

Last week, I mentioned I was working on a series of blog posts about writing romantic suspense. What I didn‚Äôt say was I‚Äôm also working on a non-fiction book series to help other romantic suspense writers.

When I say ‚Äúworking on,‚Äù I mean I‚Äôve mapped out an eight-book series that‚Äôs easy to digest, with each book being around 20-30K words.

I hope you‚Äôre all doing well and had a great week. Last week was a wee bit of a mixed bag for me. I got sucked into another project and didn‚Äôt manage to meet the goals I set for myself. But you know what? I‚Äôm not too upset about it.

Introducing a New Series for Romantic Suspense Writers

That project I got sucked into? It‚Äôs a new series of blog posts on writing romantic suspense‚Ä¶ with a side of action-adventure and spies.
